result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald M. Cholka

defendant.name: Cholka, Donald M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Donald M. Cholka
Current: PO Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States  (Effective: 03-24-2015)
Prior: C/o Jackson County Jail 30 N 3rd Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615

Defendant appeared in person in custody from the Jackson County Jail with SPD Paul Fredrickson.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  There is a joint recommendation.  Court reviews charges and penalties including the domestic abuse surcharge for the counts he is pleading.  Felong warning given.  Court reviews plea questionnaire/waiver of rights/joint agreement/elements of charges.  Plead to following charges:  11CF173 Ct 2 - No contest; 11CM36 Ct 1 & 2 - No contest.  SPD Fredrickson stated on the record why the plea questionnaire was signed twice by the defendant - he had gone over it with the incorrect charge on 11CM36 previously and so he went through it again today with the corrected charge listed.  Court finds a factual basis exists, the defendant understands the proceedings, and his plea and waiver of rights were done freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Defendant is found guilty on the 3 counts and will follow the recommendation.  Counts 1 & 3 of 11CF173 and 14CF218 are dismissed and read-in.  11CF173 - Ordered a bifurcated sentence of 3 years prison and 3 years extended supervision with 154 days sentence credit.  He is inelgible for CIP or ERP for both cases.  11CM36 - Ordered 9 months jail on each count which are concurrent to each other and also to 11CF17.  ES Conditions:  Defendant is not to co-habitate or have a relationship with a female without his agent's consent; must not contact or attempt to locate the victim or her family or her residence in 11CF173; no contact with victim or his wife in 14CM36; must pay restitution and the surcharges on both cases out of his prison wages, with the victim in 11CM36 being paid 1st, the victim in 11CF173 being paid 2nd, and the court costs being paid 3rd; must pay court costs and cost of supervision; defendant must submit to and successfully complete a psychological evaluation and must comply with all recommendations; must undergo a COMPAS assessment and must comply with all recommendations; must sign all releases of information so agent can verify compliance with treatment, counseling, and programming; must seek and obtain and maintain full-time employment acceptable to agent and must not not leave or change employment without approval from agent; must obtain housing which is acceptable to agent; must participate in and successfully complete the Cognitive Intervention Program (CGIP); must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge unless there is already a samply on file; must comply with all DOC rules and any other recommendations of your agent.

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Paul Fredrickson.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Fredrickson states his client no longer wants him to withdraw.  SPD has a conflict of interest to represent on 14CF218.  Paul Fredrickson will appear specially for today's hearing.  Court questioned defendant if he still wants Fredrickson to represent on 11CM36 & 11CF173 and he answered, "Yes".  Court also questioned defendant if he understands that 14CF218 could be dismissed and read-in and he has no representation on this case.  He answered, "Yes."  All 3 cases set for plea/sentencing on 2-06-15 at 2:50p.m.  Defendant remanded to Jackson County Jail.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
